data.message: You know about Github Pages?
https://help.github.com/articles/using-jekyll-with-pages/
^ It's even better than plain markdown, My blog is hosted completely on github and many other blogs are hosted on github with the jekyll/Github pages combination.
هو مبن عم الشيخ ده حضرتك :D :D
Ahmad Fatoum you mean Wiki on Github? I also saw an article as a GIST
https://github.com/mosamy/MyBlog/wiki
Nope, look it up.
Ahmed Saleh he is Shaikh Nazim my spiritual teacher and guide
Ahmad Fatoum  Muhammad Bassem and what would be wrong with just writing in the wiki?

Mohamed Samy Github pages gives you a github subdomain ( something.github.io ) and you can even link it to your custom domain, allows javascript and CSS styling, You can use something like disqus.com for having comments on your blog. Basically github pages gives you a static website host for free.

Nothing is wrong with just writing in the Wiki, but it's bad. You don't have full control on styling, you can't link it with your domain ( other than redirection ). If you want to link to your blog, the link would be ( github.com/username/repo/wiki ) which is awful. Github pages is the best place for what you are trying to do.

Muhammad Bassem if you read my actual post, I don't want anythng fancy , and comments can just be added on the wiki or on the file like with code. I also like simplitic text. I am even using EMACS because I have this thing now for text editors. Muhammad Bassem I will try it out but seems like added complexity. WIll get back to you with what I will do :)

Btw on github pages your content will still be version controlled. It's still in a public repo and u can still use emacs :D And concerning the complexity and simplicity, there are many ready to use templates in which you just write the post in markdown and it will handle the styling for you. I use one for my own blog, to give you an example :
here's a post from my blog's repo :
https://github.com/MohamedBassem/MyBlog/blob/gh-pages/_posts/2015-02-04-my-journey-with-trustious.md
and that's what I wrote using vim : 
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MohamedBassem/MyBlog/gh-pages/_posts/2015-02-04-my-journey-with-trustious.md
and here's how it got rendered on github pages :
http://blog.mbassem.com/2015/02/04/my-journey-with-trustious/
You can notice the difference :D

yeah Big difference, the idea is to use as much plain text as possible for me. You know when you open Notepad and just type text? No fonts not bull droppings :) But of course the pne on github pages is much smoother :)
Yeah I know that feeling :D What I mean is that the wiki is not the most convenient thing to use for your readers' experience :D 3mtn Good luck :D
Ah and concerning the plain text thing :D notice the link I've added in my edited comment :D
How about this article as a GIST https://gist.github.com/hadley/820f09ded347c62c2864
it has comments and formatting

I got what you mean. That's the basic markdown formatting. But how did you get the link of this article ? Do you think that's a good url for a blog ? If you are - for example - talking about some javascript example, would you be able to embed a demo in the gist ?  Too many limitations that you can avoid with a 5 mins setup and then doing the exact same effort that you'll do in the wiki. But with those 5 mins you will give your readers a better experience. That's my opinion :D

yup mine too hosted on github and wrote a guide for people to do the same 
http://www.blazeboy.me/how-to-create-a-blog-like-this-for-free-octopress-3-scribble-theme-github.html
also lots of people use it as blogging platform, i used it with my ruby scripts repository
https://github.com/blazeeboy/RubyScripts/tree/master/2014-06-24

I'm also hosting my blog on Github pages http://themsaid.github.io/

Matt Stauffer also created https://gistlog.co/ it has the same idea you are talking about, however I see it better to have your github pages blog, better customisation and better linking.

BTW, you can use any of these static site generators https://www.staticgen.com/ and host them on Github or even Heroku.

I migrated my website from WordPress and paid hosting to use HarpJS & hosted it on Herkou. https://github.com/ahmedelgabri/gabri.me
